definition: each in the correct place/each is provided for
each/every
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Refined ultimately formed the dividing line between the basic literary patterns they get what they want.
sentences.chinese: 從而最終形成了雅俗分野又各得其所的基本文學格局。

sentences.english: The really talented among women would always make their own niche.
sentences.chinese: 婦女中真正有才能的人總是各得其所。

definition: exactly what one would wish/to find one's niche
each does his utmost (idiom)/from each according to his means
to use sth to the full/to make the best use of everything
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
employ one's talent to the fullest/everyone gives of their best/also written 人盡其才|人尽其才
to be all the same way (literary)
to advance or retreat, each has its rules (idiom from Zhuangzi); many translations are possible
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short/in a nutshell
similar/almost/if only/maybe
all/each and every/in all cases
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
employ one's talent to the fullest/everyone gives of their best
ordinary people/commoners
to respect talent and make use of ability (Mencius)
(exclamatory or interrogative particle)
